item.description: This is a co-operative game in which 2-8 players each select an 18 card deck of cards in one of 12 different languages (Arabic, Chinese, French, German, Greek, Hindi, Italian, Japanese, Navajo, Russian, Spanish, and Swahili). Players must select a language which with no one is familiar and read foreign words, giving clues through facial expressions and mime as to their meaning. Large wooden cubes are used to build a tower on the board (which is the inner part of the box).

The first to gain 42 followers is the winner! Gain Followers by sending Disciples on Mission Trips. Have a Preach-Off to take out an enemy. Defend against enemy Disciples with Agnostics. Beef up, slow down, or mess with the guys in play using Blessings, Curses, and Miracles. Baby Jesus, the scorekeeper, also has super powers.

How to Play:

All cards that you play or actions that you take happen on your own turn, in any order that you like.

Communion Wafers are the currency for this game. The number on the top left of a card is how many wafers it costs to play. On the first turn you can only spend one wafer. The second turn you have two to spend. By the time the third turn comes around… You guessed it! 3 wafers! And so on. Spend them wisely and you will dominate. As the game goes on, things get very exciting because you are able to play more powerful cards. If you lose track of how many wafers you have available: Smoke less weed or keep track with dice. Your choice but the author prefers the latter.

Each player starts with their Baby Jesus to the right of their deck, to help keep score. Slide a paper clip around Baby Jesus and when you get to 42 Followers, you become the winner, but more importantly - they become the loser. Baby Jesus' Super Powers help keep the game moving and are great for using up excess wafers. Only one Relic may be played on Baby Jesus at a time and may be used to damage an enemy once per turn. When it has been exhausted, it is sent to hell, a warm cozy place to the left of your deck.

Besides Baby Jesus and his Relics, there are two main types of cards:

1) Character cards

Characters have Attack and Defense. This is how they compete with each other. If their Defense reaches zero, they are sent straight to hell. During a Mission Trip, Followers are gained equal to the Disciple’s Attack number.

Agnostics - Defenders who keep your opponent from gathering Followers. If your enemy has an Agnostic in play, you must send it to hell before your Disciples can go on a Mission Trip or have a Preach-Off against a non-Agnostic.
Disciples - Offenders who may either be sent on a Mission Trip or have a Preach-Off once per turn. Without gaining Followers, you cannot win so it usually makes more sense to go on a Mission Trip. If you do elect to have a Preach-Off this is how it works: You choose the character you would like to Preach off against (remember, Agnostics must be targeted first). Defense points are deducted from both characters equal to the attack points of the opposing character. This happens at the same time. So, if a 1/5 (1 Attack, 5 Defense) dude attacks a 2/1 enemy, the enemy will perish and your Disciple is now a 1/3 [mark damage taken with pennies]. Moreover, it might be a smart move to sacrifice a 1/1 against an 8/1 to take him out of commision.

2) Manipulation cards

Unless otherwise stated, Blessings and Curses affect only one character. These cards may stay in play to help keep track of who they have an effect on. Whenever they become irrelevant, feel free to toss them into the fiery pit.

Blessings - Turn your dudes into badasses. 
Curses - Mess with your enemies. 
Miracles - Save these for when you could really use one.

Now let's begin:

The game starts with each player shuffling their own deck and drawing 4 cards. Good cards to start with cost 1 or 2 wafers; you will be able to use them sooner. If you aren't happy with your hand, you may shuffle the cards you don't like back into the deck and replace them. You may do this twice. If you still don't like your hand, too bad. You'll draw a new card every turn so don't make a big fuss about it. Now flip a coin. The winner chooses to either go first (starting with just the 4 cards they have) or draw first.

Alternative 4 player version (2-Headed-Jesus): Each team helps one Baby Jesus attract 84 followers. Each player has their own deck. Make your moves at the same time as your teammate. Help each other out. You may look at each other’s hands to help strategize.

Remember to have fun. Because if you're not having fun... What's the point?

If you're into card games, ultimate, or yeti attacks this is the game for you. It's a perfect party game, 2 decks allow for 16 players.

HOW TO PLAY:

Deal 5 cards to each player.
Flip over a goal card from the goal deck.
Players can choose from one of three card types:
Offence (O), Defence (D), and Game Changer (GC).
Having the highest O-Card on the board at the end of the round is the primary way to collect Goal cards.
D-cards allow players to steal O-cards of equal or lesser value.
GC-cards add some mayham to the round and include powerful effects.
The first player to reach 7 goals wins.
Once obtained, Goal cards are hidden in your hand so that opponents cannot easily sum up your total - trickery, deception, and subterfuge are encouraged.

THE CARDS:

Offense Cards : Dump, Scoober, Hammer Time, Pinpoint Huck, Jimmy Mickle, Brodie Smith

Defense Cards: Tall Grass, Tree-Fence, Hand-Block, Gale Force Winds, Jonathan Helton, Mark Lloyd

Game Changers : Wholesale, Bird Block, Mixed, Give and Go-al, Poach, Integrity Rule, Good Spirit, Empire Builder, Yeti Attack, Beau Kittredge (Dual Threat), Injury Sub, Timeout

Booster Cards: Buzzer Beater, Wiley Vet, Lockdown Defender, Callahan, Hospital Pass, Radicals Zone, Royal Crowd Surge, Double Team, Flow

item.description:
"Mottainai" (pronounced mot/tai/nai or like the English words mote-tie-nigh) means "Don't waste", or "Every little thing has a soul". In the game Mottainai, a successor in the Glory to Rome line, you use your cards for many purposes. Each player is an acolyte in a temple who performs tasks, collects materials, and sells or completes works for visitors. Every card can be each of these three things.

You choose tasks to allow you to perform actions, keeping in mind that other players will get to follow up on your task on their next turn. Clever planning and combining of your works' special abilities is key, as is managing which materials you sell.

Mottainai is a quick, but deep, game experience.

name.value: Help Star Swirl Find the Valentine's Day Picnic!

item.description:
Help Star Swirl Find the Valentine's Day Picnic! is a simple My Little Pony-themed flip (a coin, that is) and move game published on the back cover of the children's picture book "Valentine's Day, Up...Up...and Away!"

In this game, players hope to be the first to move the length of the track and reach the Valentine's Day picnic at the end. Each player flips a coin and moves one space for heads and two spaces for tails. They may land on spaces that move them forward or back, cause them to lose a turn or return them to the start. The first player to reach the finish wins.

Big Bucks is one of the games published in Math on a Roll, a book of number games using polyhedral dice. It is designed to help teach adding decimals to children. It is played with a 20-sided and a 12-sided die. In turn, players roll the two dice. The smaller number represents the dollars they gain, and the larger number the cents. Players take turns, adding up their totals and they go. After ten turns, the player with the highest total wins.

Darkness Comes Rattling is a co-operative board game for 2-6 players that follows the story of the Tribes of Man in their quest to save the world from corruption and Darkness. Each player guides a mighty warrior and traverses a world of shadows, spirits and other dangers as they combat the coming night. Will you make the ultimate sacrifice? Will you become a mighty warrior, able to fight off corruption? Do you have what it takes to face the Darkness?

name.value: The Godfather: An Offer You Can't Refuse

item.description:
Description from the publisher:

Hunt for those who would take sides against the family. The Godfather: An Offer You Can't Refuse is a mafia-style, deductive party game based on the iconic film trilogy by Francis Ford Coppola that starred Marlin Brando as Don Corleone.

In this card game, players play as either members of the Corleone crime family or undercover cops trying to end the reign of the Corleones. Played out over several rounds, the tension of the game comes in trying to figure out who's on which side, and never knowing when you might receive an offer you can't refuse!

Unfair is an asymmetric N-in-a-row game. Players take turns placing pieces on an 11x11 board.

White plays first, and places two pieces per turn.
Black plays second, and places four pieces per turn.

White wins by making an orthogonal contiguous line of 4 pieces.
Black wins by making an orthogonal contiguous line of 7 pieces.

Diagonal lines do not count.

item.description:
Description from the publisher:

The television series Orphan Black introduced viewers to a world where human cloning is a hidden reality, but everyone's motive is in question.

In Orphan Black: The Card Game, you are secretly assigned to one of three teams: the Proletheans, Neolutionists, or The Black. The goal of the game is to influence as many clones into joining your faction as possible, while also keeping your opponents guessing as to which of the three factions you're really working for. If you can keep other players in the dark while secretly exerting influence on your targets, you'll come out on top.

name.value: Lost Legacy: Third Chronicle – Sacred Grail & Staff of Dragons
Legado Perdido: El Grial Sagrado y El Báculo de Dragones

item.description:
In the distant past, a starship from a faraway world appeared in the sky. Damaged in battle, the craft broke apart and traced lines of fire across the horizon. These falling stars crashed to the surface, and in the ages to come, became enshrined in legends as the Lost Legacy. Discover where the Lost Legacy can be found and win the game!

Lost Legacy: Third Chronicle contains two sets of game cards: Sacred Grail and Staff of Dragons. Each set can be played independently or mixed together with other sets to create a unique custom set.

As for how to play, Lost Legacy is a game of risk, deduction, and luck for 2–4 players. You start the game with one card in hand from a deck of sixteen cards. On a turn, you do the following:


 Draw: Draw the top card from the deck and add it to your hand.
 Play: Choose one of the two cards in hand to play and place it face up in front of you.
 Effect: Carry out the played card's effect, after which the card is considered as discarded.
 End: Throughout gameplay you're trying to eliminate other players or uncover the location of the "Lost Legacy" card; this card might also be in the "Ruins", a location that holds one card at the start of the game and possibly acquires more cards during play. When someone discovers the Lost Legacy, the game ends, everyone tallies the value of the cards they've played and the card left in hand, and whoever has the highest total wins.
 


By combining different Lost Legacy sets (while keeping only a single Lost Legacy card in play), up to six players can compete at the same time.

Take on the role of Egyptian nobles at the time of the pharaohs, preparing for their death and burial in the valley of the kings. Using an innovative deck-building mechanism with a crumbling pyramid, players fill their tombs with jewelry, chambers, weapons, tomb art and other treasures. The player who collects the most valuable artifacts in their tomb wins the game!

Valley of the Kings: Afterlife is a standalone game that can also be combined with Valley of the Kings to allow for play with up to six players.

item.description:
Description from the publisher:

In Rumpelstiltskin, you and a friend take the roles of fey folk who have decided to engage in a name guessing contest. You must use your magical mischief to learn your opponent's secret name while protecting your own!

Players alternate taking turns. To take a turn, you play one card from your hand, perform its actions, then put it in your discard pile. Some cards let you try to win the game by guessing your opponent's secret name, i.e., the card on the bottom of their deck). Your opponent may use a reaction, but then must tell you if you guessed right or wrong. If you guessed correctly, you win! If the card you guessed is not on the bottom of your opponent's deck, play continues.

item.description:
............VikinGalaxy............ is a cooperative game for 2-4 players with an average playing time of 45 minutes. Players take the role of the crew of a ship of Viking exploration mission to find new worlds to conquer, but one of these is attacked by a dark force, and the goal is to survive to give notice to the fleet.

Brief description of the rules.

The game consists of 6 phases of play, each with a number of attacks, which are added to increase the number of phases, begins with 2 attacks in the first phase and ends with 7 in the sixth.
Each player to start the first phase takes 5 runic letters and starts the Navigator, followed by the gunner, engineer and finally mechanics.

Attacks can be overcome according to the reaction card out, and you can meet with your runic letters and your runic dice roll.

Now the turn of mechanical reaction all the cards are removed and replaced with white sheets explosion. and the crew began their shift repairing these tabs with the combination you have in your letter. if the end of the shift from mechanical two chips of white explosion in a sector, these are converted into a red tab explosion.

The board consists of 7 sections of which 6 are marked with numbers, which is not the core, these sectors are destroyed if they have 2 records red explosion and core 3.

The game ends or exceeding the 6 phases of play or the destruction of the nucleus.

Description in Spanish:

Breve descripción de las reglas.

VikinGalaxy es un juego cooperativo de 2 a 4 jugadores con un tiempo de juego promedio de 45 minutos. Los jugadores toman el papel de los tripulantes de una nave de exploración vikinga con la misión de encontrar nuevos mundos para conquistarlos, pero uno de estos es atacado por una fuerza oscura, y el objetivo es sobrevivir para dar aviso a la flota.

El juego consta de 6 fases de juego y cada uno con cierta cantidad de ataques, de los cuales van sumando al aumentar el numero de fases, se inicia con 2 ataques en la primera fase y termina con 7 en la sexta. 
Cada jugador al iniciar la primera fase toma 5 cartas rúnicas e inicia el Navegante, seguido del artillero, ingeniero y por ultimo la mecánica.

Los ataques pueden ser superados según la carta de reacción salga, y la puedes igualar con tus cartas rúnicas y tu tirada de dados rúnicos.

Llegado el turno de la mecánica se retiran todas las cartas de reacción y se reemplazan por las fichas de explosión blanca. y este tripulante comenzara su turno reparando estas fichas con la combinación que tenga en su carta. si al finalizar el turno de la mecánica hay dos fichas de explosión blancas en un sector, estas se convierten en una ficha de explosión roja.

El tablero consta de 7 sectores de los cuales 6 están marcados con números, el que no es el núcleo, estas sectores se destruyen si llegan a haber 2 fichas de explosión roja y el núcleo con 3.

El juego termina o superando las 6 fases de juego o con la destrucción del núcleo.

item.description:
Crete 1941 is an operational level wargame of the German airborne assault on the island of Crete in May 1941. This is a solitaire game; the player controls German forces (including the Italian forces) and the game system controls the opposing Allied (British Commonwealth and Greek forces) reaction. The objective of the game is for the Germans to capture Crete at the lowest possible cost in terms of casualties. You have the option to maneuver German units as you desire within the rules’ allowances. But, when a rule calls for the Allies to do something, you the player must execute that action.

There are two general types of turns in the game: Preparation and Operational. Preparation turns gives the players additional Operations Points (markers) that can be used to enhance actions, as well as refitting reduced units. In Operational turns, the player executes movement and combat with German forces.
The map shows Crete and the surrounding seas, with displays representing the German staging areas in mainland Greece and each unit represents anything from a battalion to a brigade.

World at War Magazine #47, April-May 2016.

name.value: Duel in the North: The Leningrad Campaign, Jun-Sep 1941

item.description:
Duel in the North: The Leningrad Campaign, Jun-Sep 1941 simulates fighting between Soviet and German forces in the Leningrad region from 22 June to 27 Sep, 1941.

This design covers the campaign of Germany's Army Group North, from the border to Leningrad, during the first year of the war in the east. This game uses the same rules system as Sedan: The Decisive Battle for France, May 1940 (W24), Tobruk: Operation Crusader, Nov-Dec, 1941 (ST278) and Duel on the Steppe (ST285), albeit with some occasional modifications appropriate to the scale and theater portrayed.

The map area portrays the Leningrad region of the Soviet Union, encompassing about 600 miles from east to west; each hexagon is about 12.5 miles. The various game pieces represent the historic combat units, as well as all necessary chits to facilitate game play. Soviet combat units are primarily divisions, the German units are divisions and Kampfgruppen and are color-coded by nationality and command affiliation. Combat units may represent from 2,000 to 14,000 men, and 50-400 armored vehicles.

World at War #48 April-May 2016

Game Scale:
Game Turn: 6 days
Hex: 12.5 miles / 20 kilometers
Units: Kampgruppe to Army

Game Inventory:
One 22 x 34" full color mapsheet
One dual-side printed countersheet (280 1/2" counters)
One 16-page rulebook

Solitaire Playability: Medium
Complexity Level: Medium
Players: 2 or more
Playing Time: 4-15

This counter set includes one errata counter (the blue 4-6-6 mechanized division) for the game Red Tide West (Modern War #15).

item.description:
New World Order Battles is a grand tactical wargame of battles that were, or could possibly be fought, in the era since the fall of the Berlin Wall, and even into the near future. Players control actual and hypothetical combat units using a wide range of technologies and forces to gain objectives. Two scenarios are included: Kiev, covering a hypothetical Russian clash with NATO forces at the Ukrainian capital, and Ulaan Baatar, a hypothetical clash between Russian and Chinese forces at the Mongolian capital.

There are two players in each game, commanding opposing forces. Both games use a system of shared rules, and each also has its own scenario special instructions. The game pieces represent military units, supporting firepower, and Netwar operations.

Modern War #22, Mar-Apr 2016

Fallujah, 2004: City Fighting in Iraq is a solitaire wargame system covering the Coalition fight to retake the city of Fallujah from Iraqi insurgents in 2004. This led to two battles, the first in April and the second in November. These became some of the biggest engagements of the Gulf War. The player controls Coalition forces while the game system controls the Opposition forces (the Insurgents), known in the game as OPFOR.

This game includes scenarios for both battles for Fallujah, as well as a scenario allowing you to fight the entire campaign.

Modern War #23, May-June 2016

name.value: Thomas & Friends Tipsy Topsy Turvy Game

item.description:
This is a dexterity game based on the classic Thomas Tank Engine cartoon. The board is a 3-D railroad track display with a Thomas engine and a freight car. Players take turns drawing freight tiles. Each child must place the matching item (barrel, logs, etc.) or place an item of the matching color. The stack grows more unstable as the game continues. Other cards require a child to rotate the track, and this can cause the pile to tumble.

Items that fall off of the pile are returned to play. When the last tile in the deck has been flipped over the game ends. The player who successfully placed the most items is declared the winner.

English description:

A Colmeia - Micro-game (The Beehive - Micro-game) is a game reimplementation of A Colmeia.

In this game, players will have to leave with his bee his hive, and take 3 nectar the game board, and return to their hive. The first player to do this will be the winner.

To move your bee, use tiles of arrows that will make your bee walk through the board. There is also, at the end of your turn, choose 1 tile (Green, Yellow or Red) and put these Tiles in Tray. These Tiles, change the tempo of the game, adding new barriers and also giving some advantages to bees. You can also earn Nectar + 1, more trees or problems with pesticides.

Portuguese description:

A Colmeia - Micro-jogo é uma reimplementação do jogo A Colmeia.
Neste jogo, os jogadores terão que sair com sua abelha de sua colmeia, e pegar 3 néctares pelo tabuleiro do jogo, e voltar para sua colmeia. O primeiro jogador que fizer isso, será o vencedor.
Para mover sua abelha, utilizará tiles de setas que fará com que sua abelha ande pelo tabuleiro. Terá também, no final de seu turno, que escolher 1 tile (Verde, Amarelo ou Vermelho) e colocar estes Tiles no Tabuleiro. Estes Tiles, alteram o andamento do jogo, acrescentando novas barreiras e também dando algumas vantagens para as abelhas. Poderá também ganhar + 1 Nectar, mais árvores ou surgirem problemas com agrotóxicos.

Machi Koro: Deluxe Edition is a game for 2-5 players in which each player develop the city on their own in order to complete all of the landmarks under construction faster than their rivals. On their turn, each player rolls one or two dice. If the sum of the dice rolled matches the number of a building that a player owns, they get the effect of that building. The first player to construct all of their landmarks wins!

Machi Koro: Deluxe Edition features the base game, Harbor expansion, Millionaire's Row expansion, upgraded punchboard coins, two sculpted dice, an exclusive drawstring coin bag, six copies of "Convention Center" card, and six copies of the exclusive "Diamine" card! Only available in this printing, the Diamine features a special appearance by the diamond hungry Diamonsters!

item.description:
Little Football Game (LFG) is a fast tactical card game in which you control your own football team. Every team has it's own strengths and weaknesses. So you must choose your tactics wisely.

A game is played by 2 players and will last only 20 minutes. You can play the game in tournament mode and play several matches, so more players can join in.

There are 3 types of players: Defenders, midfielders and attackers. You can only play them when the ball marker is in the corresponding playing area on the pitch card. Every player has 14 player cards. You can choose which cards to play first, but keep in mind that you can play each card only once.

The game has a balanced system between several player qualities. Some teams are stronger, but more likely to make fouls. Some teams are weaker but are very experienced or specialized at set pieces. etc.
 Every box contains 3 different teams. There are already 6 different teams made for the game. When you buy a game, you decide which 3 out of 6 teams you get in your box. As an expansion, you can get the other teams later on if you like.

After the auctions phase, the game takes place in different hands. Each player must reconstruct the perforated cardboard on your TV the same path of red and green stamps and which are reproduced on the diagram of the presenter. During each hand is also held a treasure hunt to find the green peg. At this point you will face the test of the quiz that will to win more points.

Coin Horror is an abstract microgame for 2 players set in Myths of Cthulhu. Players must solve a case in the town of Arkham, and prevent at all costs the plans of the evil cultists.

To play you only need one board -from size of a coasters-, and a handful of coins.

In turn, players place coins on the board to score better than your opponent, while trying not to lose all the Stamina and Sanity. The game ends if any of these cases occurs:


 The fourth coin of Doom is placed.
 The two players can not put more coins or decide not to.
 Both players are eliminated.


The player with more Clue (Victory Points) wins the game.

item.description:
The Apocrypha Adventure Card Game allows you to play it as a cooperative card game, or with a game master as a role playing game. The world is on the brink of an apocalypse, set in motion by monsters only your characters can see. Gameplay is story-based, and features deck construction and character growth. Over time, characters will unlock repressed memory fragments that will add new powers. Each mission has a unique setup and goal, which often involves hunting down a true threat hiding among the cards at the nexuses that characters investigate.

The game will be released in a base box that will contain one chapter expansion. The base game, called The World, comes with 584 cards, 20 six-sided dice, 1 rulebook, 1 storybook, 30 dividers, and 10 character stand-up tokens. The remaining eight chapters will appear in two expansions, The Flesh and The Devil, each with 400 cards, 10 dividers, 1 storybook, and 4 character stand-up tokens.

item.description: A card game of rummy in which players form correct verb/adverb combinations of two or more cards. Reinforce language arts skills with the 60 cards in the deck.
A card game of rummy in which players collect two or more cards showing synonyms. Reinforce language arts skills with the 60 cards in this deck.
A card game of rummy in which players collect two or more cards showing the three parts of a contraction (I, will, I'll). Reinforce language arts with the 60 cards in this deck.

name.value: La traversée de la baie du Mont Saint-Michel à D

item.description:
The players are moving their pilgrims from one side of the bay to the other side. They use the three white dices to move to adjacent spaces (each space has a number form 1 to 6) or to jump over other pilgrims as a group effect. A gray dice cause good (collecting an archangel cube) and bad (quicksands) events to occur. Each turn the tide moves forward and any pilgrim reached by the tide drown.

From the publisher:

It cannot be stressed too often, you shouldn't attempt to cross the Mont Saint-Michel bay without an experienced guide.
Be warned, if you attempt this on your own, you do so entirely at your own risk. Crossing the bay is certainly no picnic!
You'll need to keep clear of the quicksands, take a biscuit break at the right moment and, above all, keep a careful watch
on the rising tide in order to reach your goal. Luckily for you, archangel Saint-Michel is there to help...

Capitalise on the best combinations of the dice, making good use of the biscuit pieces and archangel cubes to move forward as quickly as
possible. The winner is the first player to reach the Mont Saint-Michel with their two pilgrims.
If everyone is washed away by the tide, then no one wins, unless someone has taken refuge at Tombelaine.

4 the Birds is the board game in which you will use beak-and-taloned strategy as well as a peck of luck to be the first to "flock" four of your birds together in a tree besieged by a menagerie of other birds trying to do the same. By constantly balancing the goal of flocking your own birds and "Flock-Blocking" opponents' birds, a see-saw battle for avian supremacy ensues — and beware the non-player bird-baddies (crows and hawks) that can swoop in to un-nest a would-be winner.

Gameplay is simple. Each player rolls two dice on their turn to indicating coordinates on the game board grid (the tree) to place and move your six birds on the board. Each turn a player has the choice to place a bird at the rolled coordinate or play one of seven Action Cards as they work to achieve the winning formation of a four bird flock (either a square or straight line on the grid).


 Fast and easy to learn and play 
 Finely balanced mix of luck and strategy 
 Territorial disputes between birds is resolved via novel "Pecking Order" 
 Introduces a unique slide mechanic when birds vie for the same spot on the boards 
 Non-player spoiler-birds (crows and hawks) add unique obstacles as well as chain-reaction board-reorganizing sliding and scattering 
 Truly an abstract "gateway" game that's great for kids' spatial and numerical skills (and even better for adults who are out of practice)

item.description:
Beer Party is a fast game card, in which players try to serve and drink more beer than the opponent.
The more you drink the closer you are to victory ,but the harder it will achieve it !

Players will play face down cards in columns that form the "jars" (setting the correct cards). You may consult cards and swap cards every turn, until someone decides to "drink" one. If you can drink 3 beers will have finished the game! Time to count points.


Beer Party es un juego de cartas rápido y de reglas simples, en el que los jugadores tratarán de servir y beber más cervezas que el rival. 
Cuantas más bebas más cerca estarás de la victoria, ¡pero más difícil será alcanzarla!

Los jugadores irán jugando cartas ocultas en columnas que formarán las "jarras". Estás cartas podrán consultarse y moverse cada turno, hasta que alguien decida "beber" una de ellas. Si consigues beber 3 cervezas ¡habrá terminado la partida! Hora de contar puntos.

You’ve been invited to an awesome piñata party! Ready! Steady! Hit them as hard as you can!

The candies are dropping from the Piñata like flies. Hurry! Don't miss any of these delicious candies with flavors such as green apple and crispy cherry. Who can collect the most candies?

In Piñata Party, the players try to collect as many candies as they can from the board. On your turn, you must make two moves before picking up two or more candies. In every game there is different movement that can be used for collecting the sweets. Also included are several ways of scoring the game. The player that collects the most valuable delicious candy wins!

The game provides additional challenges in the shape of new, more difficult movement and scoring cards. Tactics are vital to avoid others looting your desired sweets. The easier combinations provide a sweet challenge for families, while the more difficult are ideal for experienced players too. Includes a special card for use when playing with smaller children.

name.value: Labyrinth: The Paths of Destiny (second edition)

item.description:
Centuries ago a desert land existed in the world of the Eternal Kingdom. The land was rich from its many trade routes and populated by a nation called the People of the Book. Wise rulers had always reigned over them, and thanks to this everyone lived in prosperity. Even so, some had rebelled against the binding order, ignoring the venerable customs and breaking the law...

You are one of those renegades and "enemies of the kingdom", but you now have a second chance for freedom as this land's ruler prophesized that among you there is a chosen one who in the future will affect the fate of the desert lands. He decided that a trial in an ancient labyrinth would resolve who would be released and who would see daylight no more. The corridors of the labyrinth are winding and bristle with cleverly planned and dangerous pitfalls. Tales and legends also mention a guard, an immortal Golem that tramps the stone corridors.

Labyrinth: The Paths of Destiny 2 ed. is an adventure board game for 2-6 players who impersonate both the great constructors of the ancient labyrinth and the daredevils who try to escape.

To find a way out of the labyrinth, each player must find a special key while avoiding traps from other players, not to mention the Golem. With their two actions each turn, players can construct the multi-level labyrinth, set traps, move, rest, attack other players and much more.

item.description:
Kids dice game. Roll two dice per turn, and pick up either one or two bones, based on the dice combination, or claim an empty bowl. The player with the most bones (or puppies in empty bowls) at the end of the game wins.
The box states a starting age of 7, but kids age 5+ should have no problem playing this.

From the box: Rolly, the tiny and ever-hungry Dalmatian puppy, is not the only one intent on hoarding as many bones as possible for himself. All his cute little friends are just as eager and make a dash, barking loudly, to empty the doggy bowls. The one who retrieves the greatest number of bones is the winner.

There are 9 red and 9 blue meeples in 3 different sizes. Each player has 3 meeples of the same color and size. The red meeples represent native American warriors of 3 tribes and the blue ones white settlers, cowboys and trappers. The players start at space 1 and try to reach space 70. Red and Blue travel in opposite directions on the blue or red path. On several spaces, there are special rules to observe, which are described in the game rules. The first player to get all 3 meeples to space 70 wins the game.

name.value: Bitten: An Erotic Game for Couples

item.description:
Do you love sexy vampires? Then this board game is for you! The board game is designed to be easily printed on 8.5”x11” paper or cardstock (or A4, for those not in the USA). You will need two regular decks of cards and dice (which you can find at almost any dollar store) for a night of sexy vampire fun with your partner. Fangs optional.

There are two major aspects to gameplay. The first aspect to the gameplay are the individual rooms (setup something like Clue). There are six rooms, each with a different theme. Within the rooms, players perform sexual or erotic tasks in order to earn poker cards. At the end of the game, the player with the best poker hand wins (although, if played correctly, both players really win ;) )

The second aspect of gameplay is the movement from one room to another. Players don't just move, they must perform various foreplay acts in order to successfully move their game piece.

In Munich at the end of the 19th century, the successful new tramway needs expansion, and the two opposing players in Trambahn are competing for the contract.

To do this, in a grid marked by cards players use their cards in three different ways: as passengers on the trams, as suggested stops on new routes to be built, and as money to pay for these routes. When laying out cards for suggested stops, players need to both match colors and build them in ascending order — but they also need to bring passengers to this tram line in order to score victory points for it.

The cards resemble postcards that feature street cars in Munich and historical parts of the city.

link.value: Lookout Games Fur Zwei Spieler Series

item.description:
A simple kids' CCG based off War. Starter sets are expandable with booster packs with over 200+ cards in the set.

Each player draws 3 cards and each turn plays cards simultaneously. Powers are resolved and each player rolls a die to add to the cards power. Highest number wins. Players place their winning cards into the Winner pile, and the defeated cards in their dungeon. First player to get all the other player's cards in the dungeon wins.

Puppy Dogs From Space is a fast playing card game for 3-6 players where each player tries to assemble their team before the other puppy dog factions can. Players must balance getting their puppies assembled while also preventing opponents from doing the same with cards like ” flea infestation”, “the cone of shame”, or “the dinosaur bone”. Each puppy also has their own special power that can be used to help their faction accomplish it's mission.

Each player has the same 9 puppies and powers. Players take their 9 puppies and shuffle 20 random cards from the 120 core cards to create their own draw deck. This will randomize the cards from the core deck and the order their 9 puppies come out in play. No two games are the same.

64 cubes with different adjectives on all sides and 13 family-friendly and gamer-friendly games to play with them.

ADJItation is fun, funny - and subtly educational. Shake the cubes in the ADJitator(box) and you are ready to play.

Some of the games that challenge your mental ADJility are:

Spin Cycle- keep spinning cubes until you hit a stumper.
Dirty Laundry - find out what your friends really think.
Air Dry - an air-writing amusement.
Lonely Launderomat - create and repeat your own urban legend.
Clothesline - name the next alphabetical noun in line.

Adventure Time Love Letter is a game of risk, deduction, and luck for 2–4 players based on the original Love Letter game by Seiji Kanai, except re-themed with characters of the hit cartoon Adventure Time. Players are suitors trying to gain the affections of Princess Bubblegum (#8).

In a round, each player starts with only one card in hand; one card is removed from play. On a turn, you draw one card, and discard one of the two, using the power of the discarded card to try to eliminate other players from the round. If you're the last player in the round, or the player with the highest card when the deck runs out, then you score a point. The game is played until a player reaches a certain amount of points determined by the numbers of players.

The card art is styled to be Adventure Time characters "cosplaying" the characters from the Tempest version of Love Letter by AEG.

There are two differences in this version. Number 1 is a new win condition. If a player plays a "Hero" (#5), either Finn or Jake, and makes another player (including themselves) discard the other "Hero" card, they win the round. The idea is that you are reuniting the iconic best buds. Number 2 is, if you manage to win the round with a "companion" in your hand, you win 2 tokens instead of only one.

item.description: A local "monopoly game", about an area in Malmö, Sweden called "Möllan".

The game is to create a panorama of a visit to the zoo. All 30 cards that make up this scene are numbered. Each player gets 5 cards and the top card on the draw pile is revealed. This is the start card.

In her turn, a player must play a card (if she has one that fits) one before or one after the card on the table. Thus the panorama is created. At the end of her turn, whether she played a valid card or not, she draws a new card from the draw-pile.If there are no cards in the draw-pile, she ends her turn by drawing a card from the hand of the player on her right.

The Zookeeper is a Joker. Once played, if a player has the correct card which the Keeper has replaced, that player may play that card and take the Joker for herself. The Snake card acts like an Old Maid card in that whoever has it when the panorama is complete, loses.

Hand-illustrated card game, fast duel of two Captains.

"Choose a ship and place in front of you. Remove cannon cards from the deck (each player takes four and places them in front of their ship.) Shuffle the remaining cards and deal five cards to you and your opponent. Place the remaining cards and the hole markers between you; leave some space for the discard pile (e.g. used cannonballs, parrot, spyglass). Player take turns. You can play two cards for turn (e.g. you can load your cannon using 'the cannonball' card and then fire it by using 'the boom' card). At the end of your turn draw cards from the draw pile, so that you have five cards in your hand. It's your opponent's turn now. 
(...)The game can be completed in two ways: when the deck is depleted, or when there are no cannons on one of the ships(...)"

More details are described in the manual.

item.description:
The object is to collect the most possible of a complete “set” of cards in sequence before the Inspector turns up. A valid set of cards is either a;
Male Nudist + Shirt + Trousers + Tie + Shoes (M) + Hat (M) + Pipe
or
Female Nudist + Undies + Jumper + Skirt + Shoes (F) Hat (F) + Gloves.

METHOD OF PLAY
The dealer gives one unexposed card to each player, places the rest of the pack face down on the table and turns up the top card which is put face up near the pack.
In the event of the Inspector being dealt or turned up in this round (the first of any hand), the cards are reshuffled and the next player on left of dealer deals.
The player on the left of dealer must now choose two cards, the exposed one and one from the pack or two from the pack.
He then discards one, placing it face up on the exposed heap.
The next player does the same, until the Inspector is brought into play. On turning up the Inspector, the player must call “Inspector” at which all hands are exposed on the table.

SCORING
Player turning up “Inspector” counts “ 0 ” for hand.
The numbers on the cards headed by a nudist and in sequence, of the same set, are not counted.
But all cards not of the same set, and not in sequence, are added and scored against player.
If a player has two or more Nudists, 12 points is counted for each one after the first.

REMNANT CARD
Player holding “Remnant Card”, may call it any card except a Nudist, but if it is found in a hand, when inspected, not holding a Nudist, it counts 15 points against the player.

THE WINNER
The player with the least number of points after playing as many deals as there are players wins

DESCRIPTION:
Your family is away on vacation and having a blast. Unfortunately, your big sister was not able to come along. Since you're at the arcade for the afternoon, you've decided to get her the best prize you can in the redemption center to bring home. Your family thinks that is a great idea, and wants to do the same.

Since your family is a little competitive, everyone wants to get the most tickets for the best prize. It's game on!

GAME OBJECTIVE:
Gain as many redemption tickets as possible by playing games with your limited coins

GAMEPLAY:
Players play games of various difficulty by matching tiles based upon color, shape, and numbers. Half of the players will be active each turn. Each turn is timed, so players have a limited time to complete matches. The more matches made, the higher the prize.

GAME ELEMENTS:

 Timed tile matching
 Variable game difficulty, with higher risk/rewards
 Each player is active (at least) every other turn

Fog of Love is a game for two players. You will create and play two vivid characters who meet, fall in love and face the challenge of making an unusual relationship work.

Playing Fog of Love is like being in a romantic comedy: roller-coaster rides, awkward situations, lots of laughs and plenty of difficult compromises to make.

Much as in a real relationship, goals might be at odds. You can try to change, keep being relentless or even secretly decide to be a Heartbreaker. It’s your choice.

The happily ever after won’t be certain, but whatever way your zigzag romance unfolds, you’ll always end up with a story full of surprises – guaranteed to raise a smile!

link.value: Fog of Love: It Will Never Last
Fog of Love: New Occupation Promo Cards
Fog of Love: Promo Card Set
Fog of Love: Trouble with the In-Laws
Fog of Love: What should we go to?

item.description:
You and your friends have been chosen by the gods to become Wrathborne; the strongest fighters the world has ever known! Using special class skills, unique weapons, and a few items, you must work together to defeat monsters intent on destroying the civilized world. This fully cooperative game will require your party to tactically dismantle each enemy in a different way before all of you are out of options. Whether casual or hardcore, Wrathborne Champions is the perfect game for all those brave enough to face the monsters' wrath.

Each player is assigned a deck of cards comprised of their specific class abilities, a series of attacks specific to the weapon they are using this game, and a few personally selected items. These decks control not only the moves available to players, but also their life total, with damage being applied directly to the deck itself.

Player fight against one or more giant monsters printed on 10x10 miniboards placed in the center of the play area. Unlike most "big bad" games, the Monster Cards in Wrathborne Champions have set attacks and actions performed each round. This "AI code" lets players predict a great deal of how the monsters will act, allowing them to make tactical choices during their turns to increase the likelihood of success.

Monster Card life is tracked via Life Cards in a similar fashion to player decks. Most of these life cards are benign, but some alter the state of play dynamically, sometimes twisting the control out of the player's hands. Players defeat a Monster Card when all Life Cards are removed from the sectors of the Monster Card that can attack. The game ends when the last Monster Card is defeated, or the final player is killed.

Cast & Capture is a unique and innovative take on classic fishing card games (ex. Casino).

In Cast & Capture, you are a mage specializing in the collection of wondrous creatures for the Arcane Academy. You must use your knowledge of the elements and arcane powers to capture a variety of mystical and magical creatures before your fellow mages. It is only by using your wits to blend the right spells and group the right creatures that you can earn the title of Master Capturer.

There are 2 decks in the game: a Creature deck and a Spell Deck. Each creature and Spell have a Power and Element tied to them. To begin, mages are given 4 Spells at random from the Spell deck and 4 creatures are placed on the field. Each turn a new creature will come onto the field and the mage whose turn it is will use their Spells to attempt to capture any number of creatures on the field that match the Power and Element of the Spell they cast. If they cannot capture a creature, then their spell is added to the Spell Pool to be used by any mage. Mages refresh their hand of Spells when they run out.

Using the Spell Blending and Creature Grouping mechanics, mages will use light strategy and symbol recognition to blend spells to create new ones and even group creatures together to make bizarre and whimsical combinations. By mastering Blending/Grouping, it helps the mage to ensure that the right spell is always at hand and maximum number of creatures are captured per spell.

With beautiful, hand-drawn illustrations and a unique split-card, dual-deck design; Cast and Capture updates an old gaming favorite for a new generation of players both young and old.

name.value: CARRIER STRIKE FORCE: A Solitaire Game of Carrier Operations in the Pacific (1942-1945).

item.description:
INTRODUCTION
CARRIER STRIKE FORCE is a Game where you are a Commander of a Carrier Air Group (CAG) in the Pacific during World War II (1942-1945). Your Goal is to manage your aircraft to successfully search for and destroy Japanese Naval, Air and Ground Forces in order to bring victory to the allied forces.

OBJECTIVE
The Objective of CARRIER STRIKE FORCE is to score a pre-determined number of Victory Points (VP) by destroying Japanese Naval, Air and Ground Units. The US has up to 24 Turns to Control at least 150 VP worth of Bases OR have destroyed at least 60 VP worth of Japanese Ships and Aircraft. If the Player does not accomplish this, the Player loses and Victory is uncertain for the Allies.

GAME FEATURES
CARRIER STRIKE FORCE is a BIG Game with many counters and a 6-Sheet Map with large Hexes. Aircraft include F4F Wildcats, F6F Hellcats, F4U Corsairs, SBD Dauntless Dive Bombers, TBF Avenger Torpedo Bombers, A6M Zero Fighters, D3A Val Dive Bombers, B5N Kate Torpedo Bombers and G4M Betty Medium Bombers. Ships include Destroyers, Light and Heavy Cruisers, Battle Ships and Carriers. Ground units include Artillery batteries, Anti-Aircraft Batteries, and Convoys.

CARRIER STRIKE FORCE can be found at the following URL: 
http://www.berserkergames.net/

Smorgasboard is a board game for foodies, friends and family alike. Players take on the guide of aspiring chefs as they work their way around the board in search of gastronomic success.

The object of the game is to be the first team of chefs to graduate from Rick's Culinary Academy by answering questions from the following categories:

4BIDDEN-FRUIT
KITCHEN-KAOS
NUUDLE-DOODLE
TASTO-QUEST

Basically a food and drink based variant of Trivial Pursuit for 2-4 players/teams.

name.value: The Undercity: An Iron Kingdoms Adventure Board Game
Iron Kingdoms: Die Unterstadt – Ein Iron Kingdoms-Abenteuerbrettspiel

item.description:
The Undercity puts a spin on the classic dungeon crawl adventure, setting it within the vast underground labyrinth of one of the Iron Kingdoms’ most famous cities.

This board game for two to four players and comes with a seven-adventure campaign. The players play one to four characters from the Iron Kingdoms universe as they try to weed out a nefarious evil that has been lurking in the Undercity of Corvis.

All players will be playing on the same team and the game requires no game master. The players work together defeating enemies, achieving objectives, and gaining experience that can be used to give new skills to their characters that can be used in subsequent adventures in the campaign.

The game will come with almost 40 different miniatures with 16 different sculpts. The four heroes are Milo Boggs (the alchemist), Canice Gormleigh (the gun mage), Gardek Stonebrow (a trollkin warrior), and Pog (a gobber mechanic) that controls a light warjack named Doorstop.

Each character has a starting stat sheet, but players can purchase character ability cards with XP gained from the adventure to enhance and customize their characters.

Combat is based on rolling dice against opposing attributes. Players will be able to use feats and abilities to give boosts to these dice rolls, similar in many ways to other games based in the Iron Kingdoms.

link.value: Widower's Wood: An Iron Kingdoms Adventure Board Game

item.description:
Sherlock Holmes is a variant on the famous whodunnit detective game (called Cluedo in the UK, Clue in the US) especially for younger children to play.

In this variant players move between 9 different places. One item has been stolen from mr. Newlyrich's summer cottage. The goal is to find out the stolen item, the thief and the place where the item is hidden.

This game also exist in a Swedish edition, made by Alga.

The Baroness DeMalus has hired two of the barony’s most skilled gardeners to beautify her walking grounds. Unfortunately, and as the baroness well knows, these two gardeners are vicious enemies and will do anything to ruin the displays of the other. But there is beauty to be found in their creations, if only they can line them up properly before the other can stop it from happening!

Seeds is a print-and-play microgame of competitive gardening and flower arranging for two players that uses only sixteen cards. It takes about ten minutes to play a game and is provided for free.

Players attempt to plant three of their own plants in a row, but are restricted on where they can plant by the plant that their opponent has played.

name.value: Film Festival in a Box: The Interactive Movie Game

item.description:
Film Festival in a Box is the new interactive movie game that brings award-winning independent films into your living room! The game is easy to play, an intriguing conversation starter, and a fun way to entertain family and friends.

Players watch DVDs of indie movies and then vote on the best pictures or rank the films. Winner is the one with most individual matches to overall group votes.

W1815 is a simple strategy game that simulates the key events of the battle of Waterloo in 15 minutes. The French side can try a number of different strategies in an attempt to crush the Anglo-Allied army before the Prussians arrive. Meanwhile, the Anglo-Allied player must focus on keeping his army in the battle by using reserves in right situations until the Prussians get into the action.

The game contains a battlefield map which is used to record casualties and the current strength of the participating armies. The cards are setup around the battlefield map with each card representing a corps. Players take it in turns to activate one corps and carry out an action. The rules for each individual corps action are described on the cards. The results of these actions are then recorded on the battlefield map. The game ends when either army fails a rout test or the time marker is moved to the night square.

name.value: Modern Africa: Rules for modern skirmish battles on the dark continent

item.description:
Modern Africa is a set of rules to fight/refight battles on the dark continent in the 1960´s through the 1990´s. The majority of these battles were smaller scale fought between warlords or other dictators. The arms were either leftovers from an earlier era, state-sponsor (US or USSR) supplied, or black market purchased. These are not the latest, greatest weaponry and they may not even be welded by trained soldiers, but the goal was always freedom.
The game is played with 15mm miniatures.

link.value: Modern Africa: Scenario Book 1 – Somalia Intervention
Modern Africa: Scenario Book 2 – Marine! Intervention Operations in the Third World
Modern Africa: Scenario Book 3 – Tears: SEAL Operations in Nigeria

item.description: In the two-player game Glaisher, players separate and move their stacks in order to connect the opposite sides of the board. The mechanis,s for separation and movement of stacks are dictated by integer partitions with distinct parts, i.e., splitting numbers into sets of different smaller numbers. Players might recognize this mechanism from Kakuro puzzles. The game is therefore named after mathematician James Glaisher, who devised a theorem about integer partitions.

item.description: Every player has to get as many of their markers to the opposite edge, preferably in the right order, thus achieving the highest points. They must also avoid losing their markers, if one of your markers goes off the sidelines on your left or right, or if your market is "eaten" by other player.

The players begin at the parking lot near space 1. Movement is determined by a die. The first player to reach space 48 at the Salamander shoe store wins the game. At severaL spaces special rules are printed on the game board.

A farm isn't a farm without it's animals. Throw the dice, move your pawn and purchase the animals and machines by paying the requested amount. Primary goal of this game is to purchase the animals related to your farm. First one to succeed is the winner of the game.

An educative game of trade and luck

Four games to learn reading.

Game 1 (alphabet game): Match upper and lower case letters.

Game 2 (caterpillar game): Find the matching words for given starting letters.

Game 3 (pictures and words): Find the matching words for given pictures.

Game 4 (pictures and letters): Create the words for given pictures.
Memory-type game with lots of characters from Sesame Street to learn matching colors and shapes.

A wild-west adventure with Benjamin Blümchen and his friends, Otto, Chief Black Feather and his daughter, Red Feather.

Twelve Cattle were stolen and must now be returned home. But the way home is hard to find: you turn right, then left and sometimes there is no way! You have to look closely and build the way anew, relocating the game boards if nescessary.

To play, the 16 large game boards are laid out in a 4x4 grid on the floor.

Each cattle is assembled by putting the die-cut cattle in a colored standee. Then, the cattle are randomly distributed between the players. All players start at the same spot on the grid, Mike Donalds Ranch.

On your turn, a player throws the die and moves his pawn along the way, one field for each pip. The goal is to reach the color-coded pasture, matching the color of one of his cattle. To do this, it is allowed to change the grid of game boards to open up new paths and maybe hinder the other players on their plans. The first player to place all his cattle in the right pastures wins the game!

Learn first language ability with this game!

The game is played in four rounds. In the first round, you only use the cards 1 to 10 and the blue cardboard counters. Shuffle the cardboard counters face down. Give each player a card with a short phrase in french on it, the lowest number starts then. Pick up a cardboard counter and read the word aloud (it is written both in latin letters and in phonetics). Each player listens carefully, and says "yes" if he thinks this word belongs to his card. He then put the counter on his tray. If the sentence from his card is now complete, he reads it to the other players and gives a translation. The translation can be checked with the translation wheel. If it is correct, he keeps the card, otherwise the first player giving a correct translation gets the card. A round is played until all cardboard counters are gone. Then you start another round with new cards and new counters. Afer four rounds, the player with the most cards is the winner.

The game plays in the palace of a maharajah. It's a mixture of board game and role play.

A crime has happened: a smaragd was stolen. The players try to find out, what happened and which Person(s) have committed the crime.

Each player gets a character (Maharajah, Maharani, Guru, ...), and instructions on how to play their character.

There are 2 parts:

 Moving a pawn around the plan of the palace by rolling a die to find objects.
 Interrogate the other players to get more information.




Both should lead the players as team or against each other to solve the crime.

Be the first to lay all your stair parts on the gameboard to win! A simple color and recognition game for younger kids.

Each player gets stair parts in different lenghts (10 with 2 players, 7 with 3 and 6 with 4). Spinn the color wheel and put one of your stair parts on the matching stair on the game board with exactly two persons step on it. It is possible that you can't place a any of your stair parts (no matching size, not able to match exactly two persons, not enough free space on the chosen stair). If so, you must collect all stair parts from the chosen stair. The player who has placed sucessfully all of his stair parts is the winner!

Charlie and Lola are always in the middle of the action! Lola likes to play with her friend Lotta, drinks strawberry milk or goes on a walk with Sizzles. Charlie likes to play soccer with his friend Marv or looks after his little sister. But what exactly is happening? Two spinners show which tile the players must find, as fast as possible! Whoever got six tiles, wins!

Teenage Mutant Hero Turtles need their pizzas badly!

Shuffle the 16 pizza pieces facedown and lay them in a 4x4 pattern facedown on the table.

Each player gets a Turtle board with its 9 matching counters. On his turn, a player turns pizza pieces face up as long as they all are matching. He stops after the first different piece and turns all pieces facedown. Then it's the next players turn. If a player happens to find all four pieces, he fills his Turtle board with four of his nine counters. The second completed pizza only nets three counters, the third two counters and the fourth and last pizza only one counter. When all four pizzas are found, the pieces are shuffled and placed anew. The first player to place all his nine counters on his turtle board wins!

result.value: Some necessary text - easily memorized or small crib sheet
Moderate in-game text - needs crib sheet or paste ups
Extensive use of text - massive conversion needed to be playable

item.description:
Dora Tip & Flip a educative Memory game with a special flip mechanic based on the series character Dora.

There are some variants in playing:

 Normal searching of pairs
 Searching a Special pair given by a Card
 Searching a Special pair given by the English Name on the Card.
